Review Film: Crazy Romance
06 Nov 2019, 18:31 by Christie Stefanie, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


'Crazy Romance' merupakan judul yang tepat untuk menggambarkan keseluruhan cerita film terbaru Gong Hyo-jin bersama Kim Rae-won. (dok. Zip Cinema via Klik Cinema)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- 'Crazy Romance' merupakan judul yang tepat untuk menggambarkan keseluruhan cerita film terbaru Gong Hyo-jin bersama Kim Rae-won. Film ini menunjukkan permasalahan dan 'kegilaan' yang terjadi atau dihindari dalam hubungan percintaan, mulai dari perselingkuhan, ditinggalkan, hingga cinta bertepuk sebelah tangan.Crazy Romance menunjukkan depresi Jae-hoon (Kim Rae-woon) yang batal menikah dan berusaha kembali dengan mantan tunangan. Di tengah depresi itu, Jae-hoon bertemu dengan Sun-young (Gong Hyo-jin), karyawan baru di kantornya yang 'dingin' terhadap kedatangan cinta.Jae-hoon merasa tersulut emosi ketika melihat Sun-young enggan menerima ajakan mantan kekasih kembali dan menikah. Jae-hoon dan Sun-young akhirnya berdebat mengenai hubungan percintaan yang ideal.Crazy Romance bisa dibilang tak seperti film romansa komedi kebanyakan, dengan alur cerita yang biasanya fokus pada pemeran utama menyukai pemeran lain dan berusaha mendapatkan perasaannya. Film ini menawarkan cerita yang lebih kompleks daripada itu.Kompleksitas yang pertama terlihat dari umur para karakter yang sudah di atas 30 tahun. Hal ini cenderung berbeda dibanding kisah romansa komedi khas Korea yang melibatkan asmara di usia 20-an.Dengan kondisi para karakter yang terbilang lebih tua dibanding cerita serupa, kompleksitas 'orang dewasa' pun muncul, seperti kekejaman dunia kerja, pengaruh buruk media sosial, serta desakan dari keluarga.Permasalahan cinta yang digambarkan di awal film berdurasi 90 menit itu sejatinya hanya puncak gunung es. Sikap 'dingin' Sun-young terhadap cinta merupakan hasil 'kegilaan' yang terjadi di masa mudanya.


'Crazy Romance' merupakan judul yang tepat untuk menggambarkan keseluruhan cerita film terbaru Gong Hyo-jin bersama Kim Rae-won. (dok. Zip Cinema via Klik Cinema)

Secara garis besar, Crazy Romance fokus pada kekacauan kisah percintaan dua pemeran utama. Namun, sutradara Kim Han-gyeol juga menyisipkan kisah cinta para pemeran pendukung yang tak kalah 'gila' dari pemeran utama.Crazy Romance memang terlihat kompleks. Namun, kompleksitas itu dibungkus dengan sederhana dan ringan sehingga terasa begitu terhubung dengan kehidupan nyata.Tak hanya itu, film ini juga dibintangi aktor dan aktris yang telah melanglang buana di industri film dan drama romansa komedi Korea. Seperti, Gong Hyo-jin yang menyandang status ratu romcom Korea dan Kim Rae-won sebagai pemeran utama.Para pemeran pendukung seperti Kang Ki-young ('EXIT' dan 'What's Wrong with Secretary Kim'), Jung Woong-in ('My Sassy Girl' dan 'High Kick!'), serta Jang So-yeon ('While You Were Sleeping', 'The Secret Life of My Secretary' dan 'Welcome 2 Life') menambah keseruan Crazy Romance.Meski menyenangkan, Crazy Romance memiliki sejumlah catatan kecil seperti salah satu bagian cerita yang dibiarkan menggantung hingga akhir padahal kerap ditampilkan di awal dan tengah film.Tak hanya itu, karakter Gong Hyo-jin dalam film ini sekilas mengingatkan dengan karakternya dalam When the Camellia Blooms, drama terbarunya.Kemiripan itu bukan hal mengejutkan dari Hyo-jin. Aktris berusia 39 tahun itu pernah menyatakan sangat selektif dalam memilih peran. Sayangnya, hampir keseluruhan karakter yang pernah ia perankan adalah protagonis dan serupa.Meski begitu, Gong Hyo-jin tetap tampil memukau dalam Crazy Romance. Ia membuktikan selalu berhasil membangun chemistry yang baik dengan semua lawan mainnya, mulai dari Lee Sun-gyun (Pasta), So Ji-sub (Master's Sun), Jo In-sung (It's Okay That's Love) dan Kim Rae-won.Sebagai penggemar yang kerap menyaksikan Hyo-jin di layar kaca, saya tetap merasa gemas ketika melihat interaksi dirinya bersama Rae-won dalam Crazy Romance. Mereka bahkan bisa membuat saya merasa tersentuh hanya lewat interaksi-interaksi sederhana.Secara garis besar, Crazy Romance merupakan film romcom yang menyenangkan dan menarik untuk ditonton. Film ini telah tayang di Korea Selatan sejak 2 Oktober dan telah menjual lebih dari 2,8 juta tiket atau sekitar US$21,3 juta hingga 5 November.Crazy Romance kini bisa disaksikan di seluruh jaringan bioskop CGV dan Cinemaxx Indonesia sejak 6 November.




(end)

Film Review: Crazy Romance
Nov 6, 2019, 18:31 by Christie Stefanie, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


'Crazy Romance' is the right title to describe the whole story of the latest film Gong Hyo-jin with Kim Rae-won. (doc. Zip Cinema via Klik Cinema)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - 'Crazy Romance' is the right title to describe the whole story of the latest film Gong Hyo-jin with Kim Rae-won. This film shows the problems and 'madness' that occur or are avoided in love relationships, ranging from infidelity, abandonment, to unrequited love. Crazy Romance shows depressions Jae-hoon (Kim Rae-woon) who is unmarried and tries to return with a former fiancé . In the midst of the depression, Jae-hoon meets Sun-young (Gong Hyo-jin), a new employee in his office who is 'cold' towards the arrival of love. Jae-hoon feels ignited when he sees Sun-young reluctant to accept the ex-lover's invitation back and married. Jae-hoon and Sun-young end up arguing about an ideal love relationship. Crazy Romance is arguably not like most comedy romance films, with a storyline that usually focuses on the main character liking other actors and trying to get her feelings. This film offers a more complex story than that. The complexity is first seen from the age of the characters who are above 30 years. This tends to be different than the typical Korean comedy romance involving romance in their 20s. With the condition of the characters who are somewhat older than similar stories, the complexity of 'adults' emerge, such as cruelty of the world of work, the bad influence of social media, and insistence from family. The problem of love depicted at the beginning of the 90-minute film is actually only the tip of the iceberg. Sun-young's 'cold' attitude towards love is the result of 'madness' that occurred in his youth.


'Crazy Romance' is the right title to describe the whole story of the latest film Gong Hyo-jin with Kim Rae-won. (doc. Zip Cinema via Klik Cinema)

Broadly speaking, Crazy Romance focuses on the chaos of the romance of the two main characters. However, director Kim Han-gyeol also inserts the love story of the supporting cast that is no less 'crazy' than the main character. Crazy Romance does look complex. However, the complexity is wrapped in a simple and lightweight so that it feels so connected to real life. Not only that, this film also stars actors and actresses who have crossed the globe in the Korean film and comedy romance drama industry. Like, Gong Hyo-jin who holds the status of Korean romcom queen and Kim Rae-won as the main cast. Supporting casts such as Kang Ki-young ('EXIT' and 'What's Wrong with Secretary Kim'), Jung Woong-in ('My Sassy Girl 'and' High Kick! '), And Jang So-yeon (' While You Were Sleeping ',' The Secret Life of My Secretary 'and' Welcome 2 Life ') add to the excitement of Crazy Romance. Even though it's fun, Crazy Romance has a number of small notes such as one part of the story that is left hanging until the end even though it is often displayed at the beginning and middle of the film. Not only that, the character Gong Hyo-jin in this film at a glance reminiscent of his character in When the Camellia Blooms, his latest drama. The similarity is not surprising things from Hyo-jin. The 39-year-old actress once stated to be very selective in choosing roles. Unfortunately, almost all the characters he has played are protagonists and similar. Even so, Gong Hyo-jin still looks stunning in Crazy Romance. He proved that he always succeeded in building good chemistry with all his co-stars, starting from Lee Sun-gyun (Pasta), So Ji-sub (Master's Sun), Jo In-sung (It's Okay That's Love) and Kim Rae-won. As fans who often watched Hyo-jin on the screen, I still felt exasperated when I saw her interaction with Rae-won in Crazy Romance. They can even make me feel touched only through simple interactions. In outline, Crazy Romance is a fun and interesting romcom movie to watch. The film has been airing in South Korea since October 2 and has sold more than 2.8 million tickets or around US $ 21.3 million until November 5. Crazy Romance can now be seen in the entire CGV and Cinemaxx Indonesia cinema network since November 6.
